verses.text: Again the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto me, saying ,

Son of man , speak to the children of thy people , and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land , if the people of the land take a man of their coasts , and set him for their watchman :\f + \fr 33.2 \ft When…: Heb. A land when I bring a sword upon her\f*
If when he seeth the sword come upon the land , he blow the trumpet , and warn the people ;

Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet , and taketh not warning ; if the sword come , and take him away , his blood shall be upon his own head.\f + \fr 33.4 \ft whosoever…: Heb. he that hearing heareth\f*
He heard the sound of the trumpet , and took not warning ; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.

But if the watchman see the sword come , and blow not the trumpet , and the people be not warned ; if the sword come , and take \add any\add* person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity ; but his blood will I require at the watchman’s hand. \p
¶ So thou, O son of man , I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel ; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth , and warn them from me.

When I say unto the wicked , O wicked \add man\add*, thou shalt surely die ; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way , that wicked \add man\add* shall die in his iniquity ; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way , he shall die in his iniquity ; but thou hast delivered thy soul. \p
Therefore, O thou son of man , speak unto the house of Israel ; Thus ye speak , saying , If our transgressions and our sins \add be\add* upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live ?

Say unto them, \add As\add* I live , saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked ; but that the wicked turn from his way and live : turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways ; for why will ye die , O house of Israel ?

Therefore, thou son of man , say unto the children of thy people , The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression : as for the wickedness of the wicked , he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness ; neither shall the righteous be able to live for his \add righteousness\add* in the day that he sinneth.

When I shall say to the righteous , \add that\add* he shall surely live ; if he trust to his own righteousness , and commit iniquity , all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered ; but for his iniquity that he hath committed , he shall die for it.
Again, when I say unto the wicked , Thou shalt surely die ; if he turn from his sin , and do that which is lawful and right ;\f + \fr 33.14 \ft that…: Heb. judgment and justice\f*
\add If\add* the wicked restore the pledge , give again that he had robbed , walk in the statutes of life , without committing iniquity ; he shall surely live , he shall not die.
None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right ; he shall surely live. \p
¶ Yet the children of thy people say , The way of the Lord is not equal : but as for them, their way is not equal.
When the righteous turneth from his righteousness , and committeth iniquity , he shall even die thereby.
But if the wicked turn from his wickedness , and do that which is lawful and right , he shall live thereby. \p
¶ Yet ye say , The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel , I will judge you every one after his ways. \p

¶ And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity , in the tenth \add month\add*, in the fifth \add day\add* of the month , \add that\add* one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying , The city is smitten.

Now the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was upon me in the evening , afore he that was escaped came ; and had opened my mouth , until he came to me in the morning ; and my mouth was opened , and I was no more dumb.
Then the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto me, saying ,
Son of man , they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak , saying , Abraham was one , and he inherited the land : but we \add are\add* many ; the land is given us for inheritance.
Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Ye eat with the blood , and lift up your eyes toward your idols , and shed blood : and shall ye possess the land ?
Ye stand upon your sword , ye work abomination , and ye defile every one his neighbour’s wife : and shall ye possess the land ?

Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; \add As\add* I live , surely they that \add are\add* in the wastes shall fall by the sword , and him that \add is\add* in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured , and they that \add be\add* in the forts and in the caves shall die of the pestilence.\f + \fr 33.27 \ft to be…: Heb. to devour him\f*

For I will lay the land most desolate , and the pomp of her strength shall cease ; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate , that none shall pass through.\f + \fr 33.28 \ft most…: Heb. desolation and desolation\f*
Then shall they know that I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, when I have laid the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed. \p

¶ Also, thou son of man , the children of thy people still are talking against thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses , and speak one to another , every one to his brother , saying , Come , I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 33.30 \ft against thee: of, of thee\f*

And they come unto thee as the people cometh , and they sit before thee \add as\add* my people , and they hear thy words , but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love , \add but\add* their heart goeth after their covetousness.\f + \fr 33.31 \ft as the…: Heb. according to the coming of the people\f*\f + \fr 33.31 \ft they sit…: or, my people sit before thee\f*\f + \fr 33.31 \ft they shew…: Heb. they make loves, or, jests\f*

And, lo, thou \add art\add* unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice , and can play well on an instrument : for they hear thy words , but they do them not.\f + \fr 33.32 \ft a very…: Heb. a song of loves\f*
And when this cometh to pass , (lo, it will come ,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them.
